summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between law enforcement officials planning the search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James (LSJ). It details coordination between the Southern District of New York (SDNY), FBI, and other agencies regarding logistics, probable cause, and operational planning for the search warrant execution.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The target of the investigation; his private island, Little St. James, is the subject of the planned search warrant. His previous NYC residence search is referenced.

events.title: Planned affidavit swearing for LSJ search
events.description: SDNY advised they are drafting the affidavit for the search of Little St. James Island and aim to have it sworn out, likely on Thursday, August 8, 2019.

events.title: Coordination meeting for island search plan
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for 1:30 PM to discuss and agree on the operational plan for searching Little St. James Island.

events.title: Probable cause conference call for LSJ
events.description: NY planned a conference call with SDNY on Tuesday (likely August 6) to discuss probable cause regarding Little St. James Island, which would determine the scope and timing of the search.

events.title: Initial planning discussion for Epstein island search
events.description: Officials discussed securing probable cause for a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's island, anticipating it would happen within the next 30 days.

events.title: Search of Epstein's NYC residence
events.description: A warrant for Epstein's NYC residence was initially for pictures and proof of residency, but upon entry, observed items provided probable cause for a full search, resulting in 845 pictures taken over 13 hours.

events.title: Previous Epstein investigation
events.description: Referenced as the investigation from '12 years ago' (circa 2007), which SDNY preferred to isolate the current case from.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively planning a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, in August 2019, with the affidavit expected to be sworn that week.
The search was anticipated to be a substantial operation involving coordination between SDNY, FBI, CBP, USCG, and other agencies, with logistics for personnel, lodging, and transport from St. Thomas.

A previous search of Epstein's NYC residence in July 2019 unexpectedly expanded from a limited warrant to a full 13-hour search yielding 845 photos after probable cause was immediately observed on site.
SDNY aimed to isolate the 2019 case from the previous Epstein investigation from approximately 12 years prior (circa 2007).
The planning emails note the challenging conditions on St. Thomas due to hurricane impacts and the intense heat and humidity expected during the island search.
